item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
https://remapradio.com/articles/this-week-at-remap-72/

It's nice when you have some extra time to do things that aren't that important but would make you 0.0001% happier knowing they are no longer around. Take my PC desktop, for example. In backing up my old VICE email, it built a bunch of weird files on my desktop and made it cluttered. I like a clean desktop. Put that shit into folders, you know? But I only use my PC desktop to stream games, having moved into a Mac for most of my writing and admin work. But I still hate that cluttered desktop!!!! Every time I turn on the PC!!! But given that I'm almost immediately booting into a game, does it matter? No. Does it mater 0.0001%? Yes, yes it does, and when I had a few hours to myself on Friday ahead of family stuff, I finally turned on the PC, figured out why the weird files were there, and got rid of them. I now have a clean PC desktop. It is inconsequential, but I am genuinely 0.0001% happier.

-pk, who is spooked about seeing Bring Her Back later this week

  • MEMORIAL DAY: A day off where I realized part of my deck is falling apart, thanks to an animal. Is it good if a squirrel finds a way to rip through part of a post and make it their home? It's not a terribly fun way to spend the final hours of a day off, scrambling to send photos to contractors and wondering "how much is this gonna cost?" Something to chat about on a future HOA, I guess.
  • STREAM: Hopshot – The last stream did not go well. A bad jump sent me spiraling, forcing the kindest version of a rage quit, where I realized I just did not have the energy to center myself back into place. Sorry. I think we're going to give this one last go before I give Hopshot a break? I do want to finish it, and I promise I will finish it on camera, but there might be logic to doing one of two things: 1) playing for an hourish once per day, letting me walk away without feeling fully defeated or 2) coming back in a month.
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – Rob is out, but Rob is now back.
  • VIDEO: An opportunity came up that'll make sense when the video goes live. Should be fun, though. It's not a way we usually cover a video game, but Chia is out on Friday, forcing us to be a little more creative on pulling this one off.
  • LETTER SERIES: Once again, topic TBD. Any ideas?
